content.body: I'll be porting a bikeshed spec to HTML. Does anyone have notes, steps, or maybe even a guide or a script to go from bikeshed to wattsi?
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: I'll be porting a bikeshed spec to HTML. Does anyone have notes, steps, or maybe even a guide or a script to go from bikeshed to wattsi?

content.body: freddy: i don't quite follow.. bikeshed does output html.. also, what's wattsi?
content.formatted_body: freddy: i don't quite follow.. bikeshed does output html.. also, what's wattsi?

content.body: Ah, I see that was super ambiguous. I plan to upstream a wicg spec (written in bikeshed) to the whatwg html spec (written in a html-dialect and then compiled using a tool called "wattsi") and I was wondering if there's something that could make my life a bit easier when rewriting things
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: Ah, I see that was super ambiguous. I plan to upstream a wicg spec (written in bikeshed) to the whatwg html spec (written in a html-dialect and then compiled using a tool called "wattsi") and I was wondering if there's something that could make my life a bit easier when rewriting things

content.body: I have a question related to the DOM standard.
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: I have a question related to the DOM standard.

content.body: That is: **why are the `appendChild()` and `insertBefore()` methods defined on the Node interface, when they only work for `Document`, `DocumentFragment` and `Element` instances?** I mean, the methods could've otherwise been defined on the [ParentNode](https://dom.spec.whatwg.org/#interface-parentnode) mixin as used in the spec which is included by Document, DocumentFragment and Element
content.formatted_body: That is: why are the appendChild() and insertBefore() methods defined on the Node interface, when they only work for Document, DocumentFragment and Element instances? I mean, the methods could've otherwise been defined on the ParentNode mixin as used in the spec which is included by Document, DocumentFragment and Element

org.matrix.msc1767.message.body: That is: **why are the `appendChild()` and `insertBefore()` methods defined on the Node interface, when they only work for `Document`, `DocumentFragment` and `Element` instances?** I mean, the methods could've otherwise been defined on the [ParentNode](https://dom.spec.whatwg.org/#interface-parentnode) mixin as used in the spec which is included by Document, DocumentFragment and Element

That is: why are the appendChild() and insertBefore() methods defined on the Node interface, when they only work for Document, DocumentFragment and Element instances? I mean, the methods could've otherwise been defined on the ParentNode mixin as used in the spec which is included by Document, DocumentFragment and Element

content.body: Is there any particular reason for defining these methods on the `Node` interface?
content.formatted_body: Is there any particular reason for defining these methods on the Node interface?

org.matrix.msc1767.message.body: Is there any particular reason for defining these methods on the `Node` interface?
Is there any particular reason for defining these methods on the Node interface?
